short_summary: Immigration Refugees Citizenship Canada has a requirement to purchase an extended inventory of security system parts from Lenel and Traka OEM systems.
tags: Alarm, Signal, and Security Detection Systems
security detection initiality utilize illuminating tones
full_summary:
========================
### Government Tender Announcement

### Title
155927 - Security Components (Lenel S2 Onguard Traka) E60HN-200ACS

### Solicitation Number
155927

### Tender Closing Date
January 2, 2023 at 2:00 PM EST

### Description
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) is seeking proposals for the supply of security system parts from Lenel and Traka OEM systems for the Western Region. The tender involves the purchase of an extended inventory of security system parts for Immigration Refugees Citizenship Canada located in Edmonton, Alberta.

The contract will commence on March 1, 2023, and will conclude on the earlier of March 31, 2023, or the completion of the delivery schedule. The deliverables must be received by March 31, 2023.

### Tender Information
* Tender Reference Number: PW-22-01017881
* Solicitation Number: 155927
* Tender Closing Date: January 2, 2023 at 2:00 PM EST
* Contracting Entity: Citizenship and Immigration Canada
* Contracting Entity Address: 235 Queen Street, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0H5
* End-User: Immigration Refugees Citizenship Canada
* End-User Address: #160-9700 Jasper Avenue, Edmonton, Alberta

### Contact Information
Roya Ayam, citoyenneté@cic.gc.ca

### Supporting Documents
The complete tender package, including all terms and conditions, can be downloaded from [this link](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/12/19/56c3fd8b25becc3d16a7f64531f7092f/npp_bilingual_155927.pdf).

Note: The above text is a rewritten version of the provided document with a more professional tone and structure, while maintaining the essential information. The original document is not included here due to space constraints. 

Only 400 words were used. Had there been more space, the technical writer would have best added links to the various related trade agreements and the short-term non-objection policy description for this specific project. Using ICT tender reference (GO-DEI), it was understood that the security systems and various security systems were bought off in one package that adhered to the agreed-upon standards as a preliminary or short-term non-objection process.
